summary: MCP tools passed to the AI-SDK are missing descriptions and have incorrect input parameter definitions. The tool descriptions are being dropped, and nested jsonSchema structures are causing parsing failures in the model.
userImpact: Users cannot properly use MCP tools with the Temporal AI-SDK because tool descriptions are missing and malformed schemas prevent models from parsing tool definitions correctly.
rootCause: Tool descriptions are being dropped during transformation, and inputSchema contains a nested jsonSchema structure instead of being flattened, which was partially addressed in PR #1890 but not fully applied.
proposedFix: Ensure tool descriptions are preserved in the transformation pipeline and flatten the inputSchema structure to remove the nested jsonSchema wrapper.
resolutionDetails: Issue was addressed through PR #1890 and subsequent releases, though the reporter noted the fix required verification with newer versions.
keyQuote: You still have a nested jsonSchema inside inputSchema which means that #1890 was not applied successfully. That's making ollama fail to parse the tool.
